sections.title: Cleric (Class Overview)
sections.description: Overview of the Cleric class including role, alignment, hit die, and starting wealth.

sections.title: Weapon and Armor Proficiency (Cleric)
sections.description: Clerics are proficient with all simple weapons, light and medium armor, shields (except tower shields), and their deity's favored weapon.

sections.title: Aura (Ex) (Cleric)
sections.description: A cleric of an aligned deity radiates a powerful aura matching their deity's alignment, detectable by spells like detect evil.

sections.title: Spellcasting (Cleric)
sections.description: Clerics cast divine spells from the cleric spell list, requiring Wisdom to prepare and cast spells, with spell DC based on Wisdom modifier.

sections.title: Orisons (Cleric)
sections.description: Clerics can prepare 0-level spells called orisons that are not expended when cast and may be used repeatedly.

sections.title: Channel Energy (Su) (Cleric)
sections.description: Clerics can release bursts of positive or negative energy in a 30-foot radius to heal or harm creatures, usable 3 + Charisma modifier times per day.

sections.title: Domains (Cleric)
sections.description: Clerics choose two domains from their deity's list, gaining domain powers and bonus domain spell slots for each spell level they can cast.

sections.title: Spontaneous Casting (Cleric)
sections.description: Clerics can convert prepared spells into cure spells (good clerics) or inflict spells (evil clerics) of the same or lower level.

sections.title: Bonus Languages (Cleric)
sections.description: Clerics gain access to Celestial, Abyssal, and Infernal as bonus language options in addition to racial bonus languages.

sections.title: Proxy (Su) (Cleric)
sections.description: At 20th level, clerics gain direct connection to their deity, knowing instinctively if their deity would approve of actions and can select an additional domain.
